body_html: I'm on Windows and CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES= or os.environ['CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES'] = '' still didn't work for me, GPU devices were still created, even if not used. However setting os.environ['CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES'] = '-1' did work for me, only giving me a warning (seems to be a kind of recommended way of masking devices according to the docs).
body_text: I'm on Windows and CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES= or os.environ['CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES'] = '' still didn't work for me, GPU devices were still created, even if not used. However setting os.environ['CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES'] = '-1' did work for me, only giving me a warning (seems to be a kind of recommended way of masking devices according to the docs).
body: I'm on Windows and `CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES=` or `os.environ['CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES'] = ''` still didn't work for me, GPU devices were still created, even if not used. However setting `os.environ['CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES'] = '-1'` did work for me, only giving me a warning (seems to be a kind of recommended way of masking devices according to [the docs](http://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/cuda-c-programming-guide/index.html#env-vars)).
